message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Clindamycin is effective against MRSA. Oral vancomycin is also effective, but it is usually reserved for severe infections. Cefuroxime and Aztreonam are not effective against MRSA.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. MRSA is resistant to many antibiotics, including vancomycin, cefuroxime, and aztreonam, and clindamycin is often used as the first-line treatment for MRSA infections.

Clindamycin is typically used for MRSA infections and would be the most effective option for this patient.

Vancomycin is usually reserved for severe infections or when the patient cannot take other antibiotics. Cefuroxime and aztreonam do not have activity against MRSA.
